perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, Licensor is the registrant of certain domain names as more particularly described below that are related to the Business which it desires to license to Licensee and Licensee desires to obtain a license from Licensor to such domain names to use in connection with its operation of the Business on the terms and conditions set forth herein; and
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, the Content Provider is the registrant of certain domain names as more particularly described below that are related to the Enterprise which it desires to lease to Customer and Customer desires to obtain a lease from Content Provider to such domain names to use in connection with its operation of the Enterprise on the terms and conditions set forth herein; and
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensor' to 'Content Provider,' 'Business' to 'Enterprise,' and 'license' to 'lease' introduces ambiguity. It's now unclear if these terms refer to the same entities and rights throughout the agreement, particularly if 'Content Provider' has different obligations than the defined 'Licensor.'

perturbation.original_text: 3.4. Compliance with Laws. Licensee shall ensure that the Business complies with all applicable Laws in respect of operation, advertising and promotion of the Business and use of the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content in connection therewith.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4. Compliance with Regulations. Customer shall ensure that the Enterprise complies with all applicable Regulations in respect of operation, advertising and promotion of the Enterprise and use of the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content in connection therewith.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensee' to 'Customer,' 'Business' to 'Enterprise,' and 'Laws' to 'Regulations' creates uncertainty. 'Laws' and 'Regulations' have different legal meanings. 'Customer' and 'Licensee' are also different.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1. Licensor Enforcement.

(a) Licensor shall have the right, but not the obligation, to take action against third parties in the courts, administrative agencies or otherwise, at Licensor's cost and expense, to prevent or terminate misuse, infringement, dilution, misappropriation, imitation or illegal use by third parties of the Licensed Domain Names or Licensed Content.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1. Content Provider Enforcement.

(a) Service Provider shall have the right, but not the obligation, to take action against third parties in the courts, administrative agencies or otherwise, at Service Provider's cost and expense, to prevent or terminate misuse, infringement, dilution, misappropriation, imitation or illegal use by third parties of the Licensed Domain Names or Licensed Content.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensor' to 'Content Provider' in the title and then to 'Service Provider' within the clause creates direct contradiction and ambiguity regarding who has enforcement rights.
